Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.passwordmanager

Interface PasswordManager

public interface PasswordManager
PasswordManager interface: login to unlock the secret data used by different modules
Since:
4.0

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • isPasswordSet

      boolean isPasswordSet() throws PasswordManagerException
      Checks if the password is set.
      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a short amount of time.
      Returns:
      a boolean value that indicates if password has been set.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • setPassword

      void setPassword(SecureString password) throws PasswordManagerException
      Sets the password. If the password was already set, this operation will fail ( changePassword(SecureString, SecureString) should be used instead).

      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a significant amount of time (up-to one second; longer on slow devices).

      Actionable reasons for failure:

      • IdpResultCode.PASSWORD_MANAGER_INVALID_PASSWORD
      Parameters:
      password - The global password value to set. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • changePassword

      void changePassword(SecureString oldPassword, SecureString newPassword) throws PasswordManagerException
      Changes the password after the password was set. If the password is not yet set, use setPassword(SecureString) instead.
      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a significant amount of time (up-to one second; longer on slow devices).

      Actionable reasons for failure:

      • IdpResultCode.PASSWORD_MANAGER_INVALID_PASSWORD
      Parameters:
      oldPassword - The previously set password. Cannot be null.
      newPassword - The new password to be applied. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • removePassword

      void removePassword(SecureString oldPassword) throws PasswordManagerException
      Removes the password. This means that it is now possible to login to the password manager with no password, by using the login() method. This is considered unsafe.
      Warning:
      It is strongly discouraged to use this option as it introduces a security weakness in the SDK. When possible, always use a secret password.
      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a significant amount of time (up-to one second; longer on slow devices).

      Actionable reasons for failure:

      • IdpResultCode.PASSWORD_MANAGER_INVALID_PASSWORD
      Parameters:
      oldPassword - The previously set password. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • isLoggedIn

      boolean isLoggedIn() throws PasswordManagerException
      Checks if the password manager is logged in.
      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a short amount of time.
      Returns:
      a boolean value that indicates if it is logged in.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • login

      void login() throws PasswordManagerException
      Unlocks all password domain(s) without the need to use a password. This operation will fail if a password was already set.

      Warning:
      It is strongly discouraged to use this option as it introduces a security weakness in the SDK. When possible, always use a secret password.
      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a significant amount of time (up-to one second; longer on slow devices).
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • login

      void login(SecureString password) throws PasswordManagerException
      Unlocks all password domain(s). This operation will fail if no password was previously set.
      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a significant amount of time (up-to one second; longer on slow devices).

      Actionable reasons for failure:

      • IdpResultCode.PASSWORD_MANAGER_INVALID_PASSWORD
      Parameters:
      password - The previously set password. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • logout

      void logout() throws PasswordManagerException
      Logs out of the password manager. While logged out, trying to use any functionality represented by password domain type will generate errors..
      Warning:
      This method can block the calling thread for a significant amount of time (up-to one second; longer on slow devices).
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.

    • reset

      @Deprecated boolean reset() throws PasswordManagerException
      Deprecated.
      The reset of the password manager, will delete all files related to password manager. Dangerous Operation! Calling this method will invalidate the data of following features:
    • SecureStorage : data no longer retrievable.
    • Out-Of-Band functionality: re-registration required.
    • Token: existing tokens are no longer usable. Re-provisioning required.
      •  Before calling this method, you need to call reset from above modules/services if you have existing data associated with them. After calling this method, user must set again the password and perform login.
      Returns:
      The result of the operation.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - exception that contains the information of the error.
      Since:
      4.9.0
      See Also:
      • IdpCore.reset()
      • IdpCore.resetSDK(ResetModule)
